Name: The Adventurer
Description: You are a peaceful, diplomatic vagabond, making allies rfom those you aid, perhaps toppling greater powers by forging strong bonds with others.

Natures.Name: Extrovert
Natures.Content: Clear your exhaustion track when you try to flee or cover allies' flight from a dangerous or overwhelming situation

Natures.Name: Peacemaker
Natures.Content: Clear your exhaustion track when you resolve a dangerous conflict nonviolently.

Connections.Name: Partner
Connections.Content: _ and I fought alongside each other to defend a clearing from a faction's advances... but we failed. Why did we defend the clearing? Why did we fail? Who defeated us?

Connections.Name: Friend
Connections.Content: I traveled with _ for a time right after I became a vagabond. They helped keep me safe and showed me the Woodland. What keepsake did I gift them?

Moves.Name: Sterling Reputation
Moves.Content: Whenever you mark any amount of prestige with a faction, mark one additional prestige. When you mark any amount of notoriety with a faction, you can instead clear an equivalent amount of marked prestige.

Moves.Name: Subduing Strikes
Moves.Content: When you aim to subdue an enemy quickly and nonlethally, you can engage in melee with Cunning instead of Might. You cannot choose to inflict serious harm if you do.

Moves.Name: Talon on the Pulse
Moves.Content:
When you gather information about the goings-on in a clearing, roll with Cunning. On a 10+, ask 3. On a 7-9, ask 2.
• Who holds power in this clearing?
• Who is the local dissident?
•What are the denizens afraid of?
•What opportunities exist for enterprising vagabonds?
On a miss, your questions tip off someone dangerous.

Moves.Name: Orator
Moves.Content:
When you give a speech to interested denizens of a clearing, say what you are motivating them to do and roll with Charm. On a hit, they will move to do it as they see fit. On a 10+, choose 2. On a 7-9, choose 1.
• They don't try to take your intent too far
• They don't disband at the first sign of real resistance
•They don't demand you stand at their head and lead
On a miss, they twist your message in unpredictable ways.

Moves.Name: Fast Friends
Moves.Content: When you try to befriend an NPC you've just met by matching their personality, body language, and desires, mark exhaustion and roll with Cunning. On a hit, they'll look upon you favorably -- ask them any one non-compromising question and they'll answer truthfully, or request a simple favor and they'll do it for you. On a 10+, they really like you -- they'll share a valuable secret or grant you a serious favor instead. On a miss, you read them totally wrong, and their displeasure costs you.

BackgroundQuestions.Question: Why are you a vagabond?
Answers: I want to help the Woodland
I want to explore the Woodland
I believe the current faction should be overturned
I must keep a promise to a loved one
I want freedom from society's constraints

BackgroundQuestions.Question: Which faction have you serverd the most?
With which faction have you earned a special enmity?

Name: The Arbiter
Description: You are a powerful, obstinate vagabond, serving as somewhere between a mercenary and a protector, perhaps taking sides too easily in the greater conflict between the factions.

Natures.Name: Defender
Natures.Content: Clear your exhaustion track when you put yourself in harm's way to defend someone against injustice or dire threat.

Natures.Name: Punisher
Natures.Content: Clear your exhaustion track when you tell a powerful or dangerous villain to their face that you will punish them.

Connections.Name: Protector
Connections.Content: I once protected _ from a mortal blow during a fight, and I would do it again. Why?

Connections.Name: Partner
Connections.Content: _ and I together helped a faction take control of a clearing, and share responsibility for it.

Moves.Name: Carry a Big Stick
Moves.Content: When you use words to pause an argument or violent conflict between others, roll with Charm. On a hit, they choose: mark 2-exhaustion and keep going, or stop for now. Ona 10+, take +1 ongoing to dealing with them peacefully. On a miss, NPCs turn their anger to you, and PCs take +1 ongoing against you for the scene.

Moves.Name: Crash and Smash
Moves.Content:
When you smash your way through scenery top reach someone or something, roll with Might. On a hit, you reach your target. On a 10+, choose 1. On a 7-9, choose 2.
• You hurt yourself: mark 1 injury
• You break an important part of your surroundings
• You damage or leave behind a piece of gear (GM's choice)
On a miss, you smash through, but you leave yourself totally vulnerable on the other side.

Moves.Name: Hardy
Moves.Content: Take 1 additional injury box. Whenever time passes or you journey to a new clearing, you can clear 2 injury boxes automatically.

Moves.Name: Strong Draw
Moves.Content: When you target someone with a bow, mark wear on the bow to roll with Might. On a hit, mark exhaustion to inflict 1 additional injury. Mark exhaustion.

Moves.Name: Guardian
Moves.Content:
When you defend someone or something from an immediate NPC or environmental threat, roll with Might. On a hit, you keep them safe and choose one. On a 7-9, it costs: expose yourself to danger or escalate the situation.
• Draw the attention of the threat; they focus on you now
• Put the threat in a vulnerable spot; take +1 forward to counterstrike
• Push the threat back; you and your protectee have a chance to maneuver or flee
On a miss, you take the full brunt of the blow intended for your protectee, and the threat has you where it wants you.

BackgroundQuestions.Question: Why are you a vagabond?
Answers: I want to fight for the Woodland freedom
I am chasing a loved one
I am on the run for my crimes
I am on the run from a commitment at home

BackgroundQuestions.Question: Which faction have you served the most?
With which faction have you earned a special enmity?

Name: The Harrier
Description: You are a quick, enterprising vagabond, racing easily from buiding to building and clearing to clearing without anything stopping you, perhaps finding yourself in places others would rather keep secret or hidden.

Natures.Name: Dutiful
Natures.Content: Clear you exhaustion track when you take on a dangerous or difficult task on behalf on another

BackgroundQuestions.Question: Which faction have you served the most?
With which faction have you earned a special enmity?
